text: <@U0504HBNVPG> just wanted to bump this and see if you wanted to write a blog post about the LatinR translation event for the Forwards blog? I have just posted a short note about our website relaunch <https://forwards.github.io/blog/2024/website-relaunch/>, so we are ready for new posts!

text: Hi, I’m contributing to the Catalan translation project (<https://translate.rx.studio/languages/ca/r-project>) and last time I entered in Weblate I could see the Spanish translation of the message at hand. Now I cannot see it anymore, despite my configuration of translated (Catalan, Spanish) and secondary (English, French, German, Italian, Spanish) languages has not changed and it includes Spanish. I’m attaching two screen captures showing my language settings and one of the messages to translate where you can see that Spanish does not show up. Do you know if I should set anything else in my configuration or is this some sort of glitch of the system? Thank you!! (This is also happening to <@U01KXU8UNRX>)

text: Hi Heather, thanks for the bump! Yes, of course, I would love to write the blog post for the Forwards blog.  I'll try to have a draft of the blog post by this Sunday.
